questions.question: Large-scale data growth has occurred in both commercial and scientific databases.
Advances in data generation and collection technologies have not contributed to data growth.
The text emphasizes gathering whatever data you can whenever and wherever possible.
Computational Simulations can have value either for the purpose collected or for a purpose not envisioned.
The book 'Introduction to Data Mining, 2nd Edition' discusses the commercial viewpoint of data mining.
Facebook has billions of active users.
Amazon handles millions of visits per day.
Computers have become cheaper and more powerful over time.
Providing better, customized services can give a competitive edge.
Remote sensors on a satellite are used for data collection.
The text mentions that telescopes scan the skies.
Scientific simulations are referred to as 'المحاكاة العلمبه' in the text.
The text states that terabytes of data are generated in a few hours.
Data mining does not assist in automated analysis of massive datasets.
The text references 'Introduction to Data Mining, 2nd Edition' by Tan, Steinbach, Karpatne, Kumar.
Sky survey data is explicitly mentioned in the text.
Gene Expression Data is a type of data.
Data mining can discover meaningful patterns from large quantities of data.
Introduction to Data Mining, 2nd Edition is authored by Tan, Steinbach, Karpatne, Kumar.
Data mining is a key component of the emerging field of data science and data-driven discovery.
Prediction methods in data mining use some variables to predict unknown or future values.
The text mentions that data mining tasks include prediction methods.
Description Methods aim to find human-interpretable patterns that describe the data.
The text mentions that certain names are more prevalent in certain US locations, such as O’Brien, O’Rurke, and O’Reilly in the Boston area.
The book 'Introduction to Data Mining, 2nd Edition' was published on 09/09/2020.
The text states that 'What is (not) Data Mining?' is a chapter in the book 'Introduction to Data Mining, 2nd Edition'.
Search engines return similar documents based on their context.
Predictive Modeling is a Data Mining task.
Association is a Data Mining task.
Data Mining involves extracting useful patterns from data.
Introduction to Data Mining, 2nd Edition is authored by Tan, Steinbach, Karpatne, Kumar.
Dividing the customers of a company according to their profitability is a data mining task.
Sorting a student database based on student identification numbers is a data mining task.
Predicting the outcomes of tossing a (fair) pair of dice is a data mining task.
Predicting the future stock price of a company using historical records is a data mining task.
Monitoring the heart rate of a patient for abnormalities is a data mining task.
Monitoring seismic waves is a method used for earthquake activities.
Extracting the frequencies of a sound wave is not related to data mining.
Dividing the customers of a company according to their gender is considered a simple database query.
Data mining involves computing the total sales of a company.
If a die is not fair and we need to estimate the probabilities of each outcome from the data, it can be considered a data mining problem.
Predicting the future stock price of a company using historical records is an example of data mining.
Monitoring heart rate for abnormalities involves anomaly detection.
Anomaly detection cannot be considered a classification problem.
Researchers have developed a wide variety of techniques for predicting time series.
Monitoring seismic waves for earthquake activities is an example of classification in data mining.
Extracting the frequencies of a sound wave is an example of data mining.
Building a model of different types of seismic wave behavior associated with earthquake activities is an example of classification.
Signal processing involves extracting the frequencies of a sound wave.
Data Mining, 2nd Edition is authored by Tan, Steinbach, Karpatne, and Kumar.
Predictive Modeling: Classification is used to predict credit worthiness.
The training set is used to learn a classifier.
Classification involves predicting a categorical class attribute.
Classifying credit card transactions as legitimate or fraudulent is an example of classification.
Categorizing news stories into finance, entertainment, weather, and sports is an example of classification.
Predicting tumor cells as benign or malignant is an example of classification.
The goal of fraud detection in credit card transactions is to predict fraudulent cases.
Past transactions are labeled as fraud or fair transactions to form the class attribute.
The approach to fraud detection involves learning a model for the class of the transaction.
Fraud detection can be achieved by observing credit card transactions on an account.
Regression is used to predict a value of a given continuous valued variable based on the values of other variables.
Predicting sales amounts of a new product based on advertising expenditure is an example of regression.
Regression is not studied in the fields of statistics and neural networks.
Velocities can be a function of temperature, humidity, and air pressure.
Time series prediction is used for stock market indices.
Clustering involves finding groups of objects that are similar to each other and different from objects in other groups.
Filing for targeted marketing is an application of cluster analysis.
Grouping genes and proteins with similar functionality is an example of cluster analysis.
Summarization is a task that can be achieved using cluster analysis.
K-means can be used to partition Sea Surface Temperature (SST) and Net Primary Production (NPP) into clusters.
Association Rule Discovery predicts the occurrence of an item based on occurrences of other items.
The rule {Diaper, Milk} --> {Beer} means that the occurrence of Diaper and Milk predicts the occurrence of Beer.
Rules discovered in Association Rule Discovery are used for sales.
Rules in telecommunication alarm diagnosis are used to find combinations of alarms that occur together frequently in the same time period.
Medical Informatics uses rules to find combinations of patient symptoms and test results associated with certain diseases.
Anomaly detection involves identifying significant deviations from normal behavior.
Network intrusion detection is an application of anomaly detection.
Detecting changes in global forest cover is an application of anomaly detection.
